verses.roman:
vāla-vyajanam ādāya
ratna-daṇḍaṁ sakhī-karāt
tena vījayatī devī
upāsāṁ cakra īśvaram

synonyms: vāla—of (yak's) hair; vyajanam—a fan; ādāya—taking; ratna—jeweled; daṇḍam—the handle of which; sakhī—of her maidservant; karāt—from the hand; tena—with it; vījayatī—fanning; devī—the goddess; upāsām cakre—she worshiped; īśvaram—her master.
translation: From her maidservant's hand Goddess Rukmiṇī took a yak-hair fan with a jeweled handle, and then she began to worship her master by fanning Him.
